subject: Good day Dear,
body:
Good day Dear,

I am satisfied to send you this mail now, though this is my second time to
email you, Like as i said that i have an ideas i we love to share with you
After I lost my husband and one of my Daughter by the gunmen because of the
Political Compromise and Post-Conflict in South Sudan my country then
kidnapped my last born after the funeral of my
dear husband with my Daughter and has not been found even until today.

I discovered that my life is in danger in the country, so I have to flee
the country with the help of the Red Cross Association in the Republic of
Benin in West Africa, situated east of Togo and west of Nigeria with my
remaining kid,Kate.

Before the death of my late husband, he deposited a sum of (2,700,000.00
Dollars) Two Million, Seven hundred Thousand Dollars in UNITED BANK OF
AFRICA, which he used my name as the next of kin. Meanwhile, if you accept
to stand as my trustee to receive the money for proper investment in China,
then I will give you all the complete information that may be required.

This is because after my explanations to the bank about my living status
now, they advised me to look for mature and trusted foreign partner who
will help me to conduct and transfer the money to his position due to the
policy of where I am living as a refugee that is prohibited for me to have
a direct claim over the deposit.

In the meantime, I pledge to give you 40% of the total fund for your
assistance, while 60% will belong to me and my remaining child as I have a
bright future for her. I hope and wait for a positive reply from you as
soon as possible. Attached here are our family pictures and my late husband
for you to see. Thank you. I am waiting for your response. here is my email
address :

Sincerely,
Mrs. Talia Adisa Daniel

subject: Re: Good day Dear,
body:
Hello Mrs. Talia Adisa Daniel,

I'm deeply sorry to hear about the tragic circumstances you and your family have faced. It's truly heartbreaking to learn about such events. I hope you and your remaining child are safe now in Benin.

Regarding the matter of the deposited sum, it's quite a significant amount. However, I'm not very familiar with financial transactions of this magnitude or international banking procedures. Could you perhaps provide more details on how this process would work? 

Also, could you tell me more about the investment in China that you mentioned? What kind of investment are we talking about here?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Christine

subject: Re: Good day Dear,
body:
Hello Mrs. Talia Adisa Daniel,

I'm deeply sorry to hear about the tragic events that have befallen you and your family. It must be incredibly difficult for you, especially being in a foreign country away from home.

Your story is quite compelling and I appreciate your trust in me. However, I would like to understand more about this situation before we proceed further. Could you please provide more details about the investment in China? What kind of business or industry are you interested in?

Also, could you tell me more about the process of transferring the money? How does it work exactly? And what kind of assistance do you need from me?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Christine

subject: Good day my dear Bank Details.
body:
Good day my dear,

I thank you once again for your kindness to help me transfer this money
into your account in your country and help me in its proper investment. The
bank asked me to provide a representative to make the transfer because of
my asylum status here which does not allow me to make direct international
money transfers without a representative.

Meanwhile, I have already informed the bank about my plans to move this
money into your account. So I would like you to contact the bank
immediately with the below information, tell them that you are my foreign
partner and that you want to know the possibilities of assisting me
transfer my (2.7 million Dollar) deposit by my late husband, Engineer Adisa
Daniel of which I am the next of Kin.

The contact information of the bank are as follows,

Here is the contact information of the bank in United Bank For Africa where
the money was deposited by my Engineer Adisa Daniel is as follows,

UNITED BANK OF AFRICA UBA. NAME OF THE TRANSFER OFFICER IS MR. KENNEDY
UZOKA. TELEPHONE NUMBER IS (Tel: 234 1 63198212, 280 87822, 700 2255 8242)
EMAIL ADDRESS  ubabankpl@aol.com

Mr.Kennedy Uzoka, Bank transfer officer telling him that you are my foreign
representative Contact him now on how to transfer the (US$ 2.7 Million)
deposited by my Husband, Engineer Adisa Daniel.

Account holder Name...............Engineer Adisa Daniel.
Next of kin....................... Talia Adisa Daniel,
Account number ................. 2048722357
Swift Code ............................ UNAFNGLA181
Reference number ................. NCRCP15.
Code repository ........................... FR92ZZZ597814.

Please make sure that you will contact the bank as soon as possible for the
possible remittance of the funds to your account on my behalf, OK? Also
remember that 40% of the total funds will belong to you for your kind
assistance while 60% will belong to me. Thanks once again and I hope to
hear good news from you soonest.

Yours sincerely,
Mrs.Talia.

subject: Good day Dear,
body:
Hello My Beloved, Many thanks to you and how are you doing today I hope
that you are doing well please my beloved i want to know if you have been
in contact with the Bank that i give you their information with my late
husband  bank details to contact please do try and contact them via their
email address okay i hope to hear from you now.

Thanks.
Madam. Talia.

subject: Re: Good day Dear,
body:
Hello Madam Talia,

I hope this message finds you well. I appreciate your concern and the information you've shared with me. However, I must admit that I haven't been in contact with any bank regarding your late husband's details.

Could you please provide more information about this? What is the name of the bank and what exactly do they need from me? 

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Christine

subject: Re: Good day my dear Bank Details.
body:
Hello there,

Thank you for reaching out and sharing this information with me. It's quite an intriguing situation you've found yourself in, and I'm glad to hear that you trust me enough to involve me in it.

I must say, the details about your late husband, Engineer Adisa Daniel, and the deposit he made are quite interesting. However, I have a few questions before we proceed further. 

Firstly, could you please explain more about your asylum status? How does it affect your ability to make direct money transfers?

Secondly, regarding the bank transfer officer Mr. Kennedy Uzoka - is there any specific reason why he was chosen for this task? Does he have any special qualifications or experience that makes him suitable for handling such a large sum of money?

Lastly, I'm curious about the division of funds. You mentioned that 10% of the total funds will belong to me for my assistance while 90% will belong to you. Could you elaborate on how these percentages were decided?

I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Christine

subject: Re: Good day my dear Bank Details.
body:
Hello My Beloved.

Many thanks to you and how you are doing today. I am hoping that you are
doing well, well Mr. Kennedy Uzoka, is my late husband's account officer
and when I ran down to West Africa I started having contact with him over
the fund.

He was the one that advised me to look for a foreign partner that can stand
for me so that the Bank can be able to process the fund and move it out to
the person's account on my behalf. The name of the bank is United Bank For
Africa UBA.

Finally please 10% is for any expense that might come up and later once the
transaction is done 40% goes to you and while 60% will goes for me and my
daughter.

And you will still help us to invest our own part of 60% into a business so
that i and my daughter will have a better future as we dream of it due, i
am not feeling happy whenever i remember my lost family but I give God
glory that i and my daughter is still alive today.God bless you and have a
blessed day.

Thanks.
Madam. Talia.



Below are the details and use it as i have stated it and contact the bank
via their email address God bless you i wait to hear from you.

UNITED BANK OF AFRICA UBA. NAME OF THE TRANSFER OFFICER IS MR. KENNEDY
UZOKA, EMAIL ADDRESS    ( ubabankpl@aol.com )
Mr.Kennedy Uzoka, Bank transfer officer telling him that you are my foreign
representative Contact him now on how to transfer the (US$ 2.7 Million)
deposited by my Husband, Engineer Adisa Daniel.

subject: Re: Good day my dear Bank Details.
body:
Hello Madam Talia,

Thank you for your message. I'm sorry to hear about the loss of your husband. It must be a difficult time for you and your daughter.

I understand that you are looking for assistance in transferring funds from United Bank For Africa (UBA). However, I would like to clarify a few things before we proceed further.

You mentioned Mr. Kennedy Uzoka as the transfer officer at UBA. Could you please tell me more about him? How long has he been working with the bank?

Also, could you provide more details about the business investment you mentioned? What type of business are you considering?

Lastly, I noticed some missing information in your message such as the account number, swift code, reference number and code repository. Could you please provide these details?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Christine

subject: Re: Good day my dear Bank Details.
body:
Hello Madam Talia,

I hope this message finds you well. I'm sorry to hear about your late husband and the difficult situation you find yourself in. It's quite a responsibility to be entrusted with such an important task.

You mentioned Mr. Kennedy Uzoka, your late husband's account officer at United Bank For Africa (UBA). How long has he been working with your family? And how did you come to trust him?

Also, you mentioned that there might be some expenses involved in this process. Could you please elaborate on what kind of expenses these might be? 

Lastly, I'm curious about the business investment you mentioned for your daughter's future. What type of business are you considering?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Christine

subject: Re: Info Bank Details.
body:
Hello there,

Thank you for sharing this information with me. It's quite interesting to hear about this situation involving Engineer Adisa Daniel and the United Bank of Africa. I'm curious, how did you come across these details? 

Also, could you tell me more about Mr. Kennedy Uzoka's role as a transfer officer? What exactly does his job entail?

I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Remember, I won't be able to provide any personal information in our conversation.

Best wishes,
Christine

subject: Re: Hello My Beloved.
body:
Hello Madam Talia,

I hope this message finds you well. I'm sorry to hear about your late husband and the difficult situation you find yourself in. It's quite a responsibility to handle such a large fund, especially under these circumstances.

You mentioned Mr. Kennedy Uzoka, your late husband's account officer at United Bank For Africa (UBA). How long has he been working with your family? And how did he come to suggest that you look for a foreign partner?

Also, could you please clarify what you mean by "any expense that might come up"? Are there any specific costs or fees associated with transferring the fund?

subject: Re: Hello My Beloved.
body:
Hello my dear thank for your prompt response, please i don,t know whatever
it might cost but i am just setting the 10% aside if any and again i want
you to know that my late husband have know Mr. Kennedy Uzoka,and he is his
account officer so i we like you to please do try and used all the details
that i give to you and contact the bank, no i don't have any business in
mind but i hope you can help me to get one, thank you.

Thanks.
Madam. Talia.

Mrs.Talia Adisa Daniel.

subject: Re: Hello My Beloved.
body:
Hello Mrs. Talia Adisa Daniel,

I'm sorry to hear about your late husband, that must have been a very difficult time for you. I hope you're doing well now.

It's interesting to meet someone from South Sudan, I've never had the chance to visit East Africa before. You mentioned that there are some ideas you'd like to share with me? I'm all ears and would love to hear more about them.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Christine
